answers.answer: Age/weight/height?diabeteshealth.com has an article titled:  "When Diabetes Leads to a Lazy Stomach: The Goods on Gastroparesis", which you may find interesting reading.

question: I've been seeing a gastroenterologist for awhile now about 6 to 8 months he's put me on lyrica for pain and now he's moved me to 300 mgs at a time and now I'm sick all the time pain, nausea, constipation,  I don't know what else to do.  I've tried to tell him that I'm nauseous all the time almost feels like I'm starving all the time and as soon as I eat I'm throwing up which usually leads to the hospital.  I take promethazine 50 mgs every day for nausea, but it's not working like it did in the beginning.  I can't hold down a job because I'm to sick to get out of bed some days I guess I'm looking for some ideas on what's going on.  My dr. said I have Diabetic Neuropathy of the Stomach lining.  I don't know what to do?????any help is great.
title: stomach pain, severe almost all the time
